We write further to our email to you dated 14 July 2025 reminding you to send us renewed compliant insurance in respect of the above, which has still not been received.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet renewed your insurance, then please ensure that you do so immediately and send it to us for approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Details of your non-compliant insurance is as follows:

 

Property All Risk and Business Interruption – Expired 1 July 2025

 

Please address the above issues as soon as possible and provide us with updated insurance policies for our approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action being taken.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with renewed compliant insurance within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Ethics & Compliance Executive

Rebecca

WARNING: This Message Is From an External Sender. Should you have any doubt, click on the report button in Outlook.

________________________________

 

Dear Lucas,

 

 

Your insurances are not compliant.

 

I set my comments below;

 

 

WC-EL - Limit should be AED 1,000,000 any one occurrence and the aggregate should be removed. Also, Primary insurance clause and Waiver of Subrogation are required.

 

TPL- The aggregate should be removed. Also requires Additional insured, Primary insurance clause, Waiver of Subrogation and Cross Liability clause.

 

 

Looking forward in receiving the amended policies and PAR-BI.

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Dear Analy

 

Your Property All Risk, Business Interruption and Workmen’s Compensation and Employer’s Liability insurance is due to expire on 30 June 2025 and your Third Party Liability insurance is due to expire 1 July 2024. We would like to take this opportunity to remind you to renew this on time and provide us with a copy as soon as you have done so.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease. 

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Rebecca

We write further to our email to you dated 14 July 2025 reminding you to send us renewed compliant insurance in respect of the above, which has still not been received.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet renewed your insurance, then please ensure that you do so immediately and send it to us for approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Details of your non-compliant insurance is as follows:

 

Property All Risk and Business Interruption – Expired 1 July 2025

 

Please address the above issues as soon as possible and provide us with updated insurance policies for our approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action being taken.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with renewed compliant insurance within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Rebecca

WARNING: This Message Is From an External Sender. Should you have any doubt, click on the report button in Outlook.

Dear Lucas,

 

 

Your insurances are not compliant.

 

I set my comments below;

 

 

WC-EL - Limit should be AED 1,000,000 any one occurrence and the aggregate should be removed. Also, Primary insurance clause and Waiver of Subrogation are required.

 

TPL- The aggregate should be removed. Also requires Additional insured, Primary insurance clause, Waiver of Subrogation and Cross Liability clause.

 

 

Looking forward in receiving the amended policies and PAR-BI.

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Dear Analy

 

Your Property All Risk, Business Interruption and Workmen’s Compensation and Employer’s Liability insurance is due to expire on 30 June 2025 and your Third Party Liability insurance is due to expire 1 July 2024. We would like to take this opportunity to remind you to renew this on time and provide us with a copy as soon as you have done so.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease. 

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Rebecca

We write further to our email to you dated 14 July 2025 reminding you to send us renewed compliant insurance in respect of the above, which has still not been received.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet renewed your insurance, then please ensure that you do so immediately and send it to us for approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Details of your non-compliant insurance is as follows:

 

Property All Risk and Business Interruption – Expired 1 July 2025

 

Please address the above issues as soon as possible and provide us with updated insurance policies for our approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action being taken.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with renewed compliant insurance within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Rebecca

WARNING: This Message Is From an External Sender. Should you have any doubt, click on the report button in Outlook.

Dear Lucas,

 

 

Your insurances are not compliant.

 

I set my comments below;

 

 

WC-EL - Limit should be AED 1,000,000 any one occurrence and the aggregate should be removed. Also, Primary insurance clause and Waiver of Subrogation are required.

 

TPL- The aggregate should be removed. Also requires Additional insured, Primary insurance clause, Waiver of Subrogation and Cross Liability clause.

 

 

Looking forward in receiving the amended policies and PAR-BI.

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Dear Analy

 

Your Property All Risk, Business Interruption and Workmen’s Compensation and Employer’s Liability insurance is due to expire on 30 June 2025 and your Third Party Liability insurance is due to expire 1 July 2024. We would like to take this opportunity to remind you to renew this on time and provide us with a copy as soon as you have done so.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease. 

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Rebecca

Dear Lucas,

 

We write further to our email to you dated 14 July 2025 reminding you to send us renewed compliant insurance in respect of the above, which has still not been received.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet renewed your insurance, then please ensure that you do so immediately and send it to us for approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Details of your non-compliant insurance is as follows:

 

Property All Risk and Business Interruption – Expired 1 July 2025

 

Please address the above issues as soon as possible and provide us with updated insurance policies for our approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action being taken.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with renewed compliant insurance within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Ethics & Compliance Executive

Rebecca

WARNING: This Message Is From an External Sender. Should you have any doubt, click on the report button in Outlook.

________________________________

 

Dear Lucas,

 

 

Your insurances are not compliant.

 

I set my comments below;

 

 

WC-EL - Limit should be AED 1,000,000 any one occurrence and the aggregate should be removed. Also, Primary insurance clause and Waiver of Subrogation are required.

 

TPL- The aggregate should be removed. Also requires Additional insured, Primary insurance clause, Waiver of Subrogation and Cross Liability clause.

 

 

Looking forward in receiving the amended policies and PAR-BI.

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Dear Analy

 

Your Property All Risk, Business Interruption and Workmen’s Compensation and Employer’s Liability insurance is due to expire on 30 June 2025 and your Third Party Liability insurance is due to expire 1 July 2024. We would like to take this opportunity to remind you to renew this on time and provide us with a copy as soon as you have done so.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease. 

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Rebecca

We write further to our email to you dated 14 July 2025 reminding you to send us renewed compliant insurance in respect of the above, which has still not been received.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet renewed your insurance, then please ensure that you do so immediately and send it to us for approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Details of your non-compliant insurance is as follows:

 

Property All Risk and Business Interruption – Expired 1 July 2025

 

Please address the above issues as soon as possible and provide us with updated insurance policies for our approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action being taken.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with renewed compliant insurance within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Rebecca

WARNING: This Message Is From an External Sender. Should you have any doubt, click on the report button in Outlook.

Dear Lucas,

 

 

Your insurances are not compliant.

 

I set my comments below;

 

 

WC-EL - Limit should be AED 1,000,000 any one occurrence and the aggregate should be removed. Also, Primary insurance clause and Waiver of Subrogation are required.

 

TPL- The aggregate should be removed. Also requires Additional insured, Primary insurance clause, Waiver of Subrogation and Cross Liability clause.

 

 

Looking forward in receiving the amended policies and PAR-BI.

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Dear Lucas,

 

We write further to our email to you dated 14 July 2025 reminding you to send us renewed compliant insurance in respect of the above, which has still not been received.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet renewed your insurance, then please ensure that you do so immediately and send it to us for approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Details of your non-compliant insurance is as follows:

 

Property All Risk and Business Interruption – Expired 1 July 2025

 

Please address the above issues as soon as possible and provide us with updated insurance policies for our approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action being taken.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with renewed compliant insurance within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Ethics & Compliance Executive

Dear Lucas,

 

 

Your insurances are not compliant.

 

I set my comments below;

 

 

WC-EL - Limit should be AED 1,000,000 any one occurrence and the aggregate should be removed. Also, Primary insurance clause and Waiver of Subrogation are required.

 

TPL- The aggregate should be removed. Also requires Additional insured, Primary insurance clause, Waiver of Subrogation and Cross Liability clause.

 

 

Looking forward in receiving the amended policies and PAR-BI.

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Dear Analy

 

Your Property All Risk, Business Interruption and Workmen’s Compensation and Employer’s Liability insurance is due to expire on 30 June 2025 and your Third Party Liability insurance is due to expire 1 July 2024. We would like to take this opportunity to remind you to renew this on time and provide us with a copy as soon as you have done so.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease. 

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Rebecca

 

 

Rebecca Lane

chunks.text:
Dear Lucas,

 

We write further to our email to you dated 14 July 2025 reminding you to send us renewed compliant insurance in respect of the above, which has still not been received.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet renewed your insurance, then please ensure that you do so immediately and send it to us for approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Details of your non-compliant insurance is as follows:

 

Property All Risk and Business Interruption – Expired 1 July 2025

 

Please address the above issues as soon as possible and provide us with updated insurance policies for our approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action being taken.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with renewed compliant insurance within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Ethics & Compliance Executive

Rebecca

Dear Lucas,

 

 

Your insurances are not compliant.

 

I set my comments below;

 

 

WC-EL - Limit should be AED 1,000,000 any one occurrence and the aggregate should be removed. Also, Primary insurance clause and Waiver of Subrogation are required.

 

TPL- The aggregate should be removed. Also requires Additional insured, Primary insurance clause, Waiver of Subrogation and Cross Liability clause.

 

 

Looking forward in receiving the amended policies and PAR-BI.

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Dear Analy

 

Your Property All Risk, Business Interruption and Workmen’s Compensation and Employer’s Liability insurance is due to expire on 30 June 2025 and your Third Party Liability insurance is due to expire 1 July 2024. We would like to take this opportunity to remind you to renew this on time and provide us with a copy as soon as you have done so.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease. 

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Rebecca

 

 

Rebecca Lane

Dear Lucas,

 

We write further to our email to you dated 14 July 2025 reminding you to send us renewed compliant insurance in respect of the above, which has still not been received.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet renewed your insurance, then please ensure that you do so immediately and send it to us for approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Details of your non-compliant insurance is as follows:

 

Property All Risk and Business Interruption – Expired 1 July 2025

 

Please address the above issues as soon as possible and provide us with updated insurance policies for our approval within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain compliant insurance under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action being taken.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with renewed compliant insurance within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri

Ethics & Compliance Executive

Lucas

 

Under the terms of your Lease your Employer’s Liability should be AED1m.  You are also covered under your TPL for Employer’s Liability in the sum of EUR3m so you can remove the aggregate here for your Galleria unit.

 

Please ensure the clauses are added to both policies and also to your PAR and BI as well.

 

I am reattaching your Insurance requirements under your Lease.

 

I look forward to receiving amended policies.

 

Rebecca

WARNING: This Message Is From an External Sender. Should you have any doubt, click on the report button in Outlook.

________________________________

 

Dear Lucas,

 

 

Your insurances are not compliant.

 

I set my comments below;

 

 

WC-EL - Limit should be AED 1,000,000 any one occurrence and the aggregate should be removed. Also, Primary insurance clause and Waiver of Subrogation are required.

 

TPL- The aggregate should be removed. Also requires Additional insured, Primary insurance clause, Waiver of Subrogation and Cross Liability clause.

 

 

Looking forward in receiving the amended policies and PAR-BI.

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri
